selected_links.title: Check if you need planning permission | Borough Council of King's Lynn & West Norfolk
strengths: Provides information on whether you need planning permission for various projects.
Discusses exempted development categories, including certain solar PV installations.
selected_links.reasoning: Link 2 provides clear information about when planning permission is required for different types of construction, including mention of solar PV panels. The document also explains that some projects fall under exempted development categories and might not require permission.

context.need: I'd like to install solar panels on my house and want to know if I need permission to have someone undertake this work.

recommendation.reason: Link appears suitable for user needs
next_steps: Follow the link to access the content

Reason.need: To know whether I need permission to install solar panels on my house
Reason.reasoning: Although the content does not explicitly mention solar panel installation, it provides a general guide on how to check if planning permission is required for any building work. However, the specific case of solar panels might require more detailed information or a direct inquiry to the council.
Reason.next_actions: Consulting with a local authority representative about solar panels installation and their specific requirements would be the next step.

analysis.overall_assessment: While the content provides a good overview of the planning permission process, it does not directly address the specific need of installing solar panels on a house. Additional information or a dedicated section for green energy projects may improve its utility.
